summary:
" Do you trust me?"
Ik that the trailer shows caps torn up uniform but I think it's just cgi and it's the Cap from 2012 ...
body:
“ Do you trust me?”

Ik that the trailer shows caps torn up uniform but I think it’s just cgi and it’s the Cap from 2012 avengers during the New York battle and he’s confused to as why is a silver haired Tony Stark here when iron man is flying above. That’s why Tony asks him “Do you trust me?”

Because this…

There has been much discord over why Tony shouldn’t be the one to ask that question and I highly support that but look at it from this angle…

This isnt the Steve that betrayed Tony. This is the man out of time dealing with a literal man out of his time asking Cap to trust his judgement.

summary: I’m seeing Discourse about Clint Barton People are making fun of him for the midlife crisis, the hair and the tattoo and...
body:
I’m seeing Discourse about Clint Barton

People are making fun of him for the midlife crisis, the hair and the tattoo and whatnot. And I get it, I do. It’s ridiculous, it feels like a really ridiculous reaction.

But. I would like you all to think about how this is the Marvel Cinematic Universe. And if you do think about it, Clint’s reaction to losing his family is actually… not that ridiculous.

Tony almost lost Pepper to Extremis and as a reaction, he destroyed all the Iron Man suits.

Steve lost his best friend when Bucky fell off the train and a few days later, he killed himself by putting the Valkyrie in the water.

Thor lost his mother and not only did he go after the dark elves, creatures of mythical history even for Asgard, but he also accepted Loki’s crazy ass plans about getting out of Asgard and defeating the elves. 

So really, if you think about it

Clint lost all of his family, that he had been keeping safe and secret for decades, and as a reaction, he did what he did best: picked up his weapons and went after bad guys. Sure, he’s brutal about it, no mercy, but we knew he had it in him. And it’s understandable that he’d go in such a dark place, because the pain he’s feeling, it’s bound to take him somewhere dark. 

By the looks of things, they’re all in a dark place. Really, it’s understandable.

There’s a discussion to be had, about how Clint was before Shield, about how he ended up with a wife and kids, about what happened, in his life, that led him to that. About what happened in his life that made him capable of becoming someone as dark and ruthless as Ronin. But we can’t have that discussion, can we? Because we don’t know. We know Clint’s background in the comics, but MCU’s Clint is really far from that. So we have no idea.

Yes, the hair and tattoo are weird, but I feel like they’re normal reactions. Clint changed, on a fundamental level: emotionally, in ideology, lifestyle, in everything. Of course he’d want his exterior to change too.

And, honestly now, we’re a generation that deals with depression by dying their hair crazy colors and getting fandom related tattoos. 

Clint’s reaction? Totally normal.

Get off his case and give him a hug. Lord knows he needs it.


[LATER EDIT]

blog.description:
(RP BLOG: EVXRGRCWING )    
 Heya! Name's Dani! I am a woman of many fandoms! I'm a safe space from any fandom discourse, if you're looking to get away from it all and have someone to rant to about it! However, I do not tolerate hate of any kind on this blog. So if you have something hurtful or shitty to say to me or anyone I speak to, keep it to yourself and fuck off. Anywho... That's probably enough about me... Welcome to my blog, then!  
                                              
Wattpad: danifandxm
Discord: Dani#5297 (if you cant find me, message me your discord and I'll request you from there.)

title: Running From My Shadow
body:
Loki has escaped the Asgard prison, again.

Soft Praise To a Hard Lie

It had become one of his favorite hobbies, if not the only one. Sneaking out of prison every other day was something that filled Loki with joy, whether it was to steal something or play pranks on Thor…

Read more…
